Text.val: This sample is using PushSharp API to send messages to Android, iOS and Windows 10 mobile
Before you use it, you need to configure your app to support push notification as mentioned at:
Initiate the connection for Windows 10 mobile
For iOS, non-interactive task cannot be used for sending the notifications. Hence send the notification from here
iOS now uses https://github.com/alexalok/dotAPNS library to send notifications using http2 protocol

Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}{\f1\fswiss\fprq2\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} \viewkind4\uc1\pard\ltrpar\cf1\b\f0\fs20 This sample sends a push notification to Android, iOS and Windows 10 mobile devices using PushSharp .NET code.\par Note that before sending messages to your mobile device you need to:\par 1. Modify the application on the mobile device as mentioned in sample \cf2 RNC06\cf1 .\f1\par \f0 2. For Android - Update the 'Android Server key' variable with your Server API key.\par 3. For Windows 10 mobile - Update the 'Win10Mobile Package name', 'Win10Mobile Package SID' and 'Win10Mobile Client secret' variables with the package name, package SID and secret code,\par 4. For iOS - Update the 'iOS certificate path', 'iOS certificate password' and 'iOS - using production provisioning?' variables with the certificate path and password.\par 5. For iOS - make sure ports 2195 and 2196 are opened on the firewall. Otherwise the message will not be sent and the appearance will be of a hanged application until the timeout is reached.\par 6, Add your device IDs to the device list (using the Browse Device List button) or by running sample \cf2 RNC06\cf1 on your mobile device.\par }

ExpSyntax.val: AppendToResult('Please wait. The process is asynchronous')

Text.val: Update the list of all device IDs into Vector
